name: Heiko Röglin
content: Heiko Röglin Home Publications Projects Teaching Heiko Röglin Professor of Computer Science Universität Bonn Institut für Informatik, Abteilung V Friedrich-Hirzebruch-Allee 8 53115 Bonn, Germany Room 2.073 Email: roeglin@cs.uni-bonn.de Phone: +49 228 73 4326 Research Interests I am particularly interested in the following areas of theoretical computer science: Beyond Worst-Case Analysis Cluster Analysis Algorithmic Game Theory Online Algorithms For a list of my publications, please visit my publication page or see dblp or Google Scholar. Research Group Jan Eube Andreas Hene Joshua KÃ¶nen PD Dr. Elmar Langetepe Dr. Anurag Murty Naredla Sarah Sturm Former PhD students and postdocs Dr. Andreas Abels Dr. Antonios Antoniadis Dr. Anna Arutyunova Anup Bhattacharya, PhD Dr. Tobias Brunsch Dr. Michael Etscheid Dr. Carsten Fischer Dr. Anna Großwendt Dr. Kelin Luo Prof. Dr. Matthias Mnich Dr. Clemens Rösner Dr. Daniel Schmidt Prof. Dr. Melanie Schmidt Dr. Xianghui Zhong Brief Curriculum Vitae since July 2013 Professor (W3) of Theoretical Computer Science at the University of Bonn Oct. 2010 - June 2013 Professor (W2) of Theoretical Computer Science at the University of Bonn July 2009 - Sept. 2010 Assistant Professor of Operations Research at Maastricht University July 2008 - June 2009 Postdoctoral Research Fellow at Boston University working with Shang-Hua Teng May 2008 - June 2008 Visiting Researcher at the Theory Group of Microsoft Research Asia in Beijing Oct. 2004 - April 2008 Ph.D. student in the Algorithms and Complexity Group at RWTH Aachen headed by Berthold Vöcking Oct. 2000 - Aug. 2004 Computer Science Student at the University of Dortmund
